column12: Systems and methods for mine detection
column13: Systems, methods, and devices for detecting land mines and unexploded ordnance are disclosed. A first embodiment may be construed as a method that includes: inserting an antenna into the ground; transmitting an electromagnetic signal into the ground via the antenna; receiving a response via the antenna; and processing the response to generate an image which can be examined to determine whether a mine exists within proximity of the antenna.
column16: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AS REPRESENTED BY THE SECRETARY OF THE ARMY (2006-03-13)

column12: Polynucleotides encoding polymorphic human GABAA receptor alpha-6 subunit
column13: Compositions and methods based on a polymorphism in the gene encoding the 6 subunit of the human GABA _{ A } neurotransmitter receptor are disclosed. This polymorphism results in the substitution of a serine residue for a proline residue ordinarily present at amino acid position 385 of the 6 polypeptide sequence. Significantly, the polymorphism was associated with decreased sensitivity to ethanol and benzodiazepine drugs.
column16: GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AS REPRESENTED BY THE SECRETARY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (2002-12-11)

column12: Polymorphic human GABAA receptor alpha-6 subunit
column13: Compositions and methods based on a polymorphism in the gene encoding the 6 subunit of the human GABA _{A } neurotransmitter receptor are disclosed. This polymorphism results in the substitution of a serine residue for a proline residue ordinarily present at amino acid position 385 of the 6 polypeptide sequence. Significantly, the polymorphism was associated with decreased sensitivity to ethanol and benzodiazepine drugs.
column16: GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AS REPRESENTED BY THE SECRETARY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (2002-12-11)

column13: An optical position encoder includes a scale having multiple tracks separated in a direction perpendicular to travel, the tracks including an incremental track and an absolute track, the scale interacting with an incident first light beam to generate a second light beam having components carrying respective optical patterns produced by the incremental track and absolute track respectively. The encoder further includes a set of optical detectors including at least first and second detector arrays of differing properties to detect the respective optical patterns produced by the incremental track and absolute track respectively, each of the first and second detector arrays spanning multiple tracks of the scale and configured to respond to a respective detector-specific component of the second light beam more strongly than to another component of the second beam specific to another of the detector arrays.
column15: GOLDMAN ANDREW M;;BERNARD MARC A;;THORBURN WILLIAM G

column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an encoder for optically filtering trouble of a scale and an influence of contamination and outputting an accurate signal.SOLUTION: An encoder includes a scale that includes a plurality of tracks including an increment track and an absolute track separated in a direction orthogonal to an advance direction, and generates second rays including respective components having optical patterns formed by each of the increment track and the absolute track by interaction with first incident rays. In a set of photodetectors including at least first and second detector arrays having different performances for detecting optical patterns formed by each of the increment track and the absolute track, the first and second detector arrays are configured so as to extend to a plurality of tracks of the scale each, and the other of the detector arrays corresponding to a second ray more strongly reacts with a detector corresponding to the second ray for a characteristic component than another characteristic component.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2
column15: ANDREW M GOLDMAN;;MARC A BERNARD;;WILLIAM G THORBURN
